intro: Argyreia linggaensis, commonly known as the Lingga morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in vibrant shades of purple and blue. The plant is a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and ample sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
